Pre-Game Insights: Liam Livingstone will lead an inexperienced group in three ODIs in the Caribbean.
Livingstone will lead England in the series-opening ODI against the West Indies on Thursday.
Captain Jos Buttler’s nagging calf problem has sidelined him since the end of England’s T20 World Cup in late June.

Jordan Cox, named as England’s next Test wicketkeeper, plus batting all-rounder Dan Mousley and fast bowler John Turner are poised for debuts in a 16-strong squad where six members are uncapped in ODIs.
Promising leg-spinner Jafer Chohan may feature at some point.
Livingstone urged the youngsters to seize the moment in what is the tourists’ penultimate ODI series before next year’s Champions Trophy.
Shimron Hetmyer is likely to make his first ODI appearance in nearly 11 months for the Windies, having averaged 11.33 in six innings, with 17-year-old wicketkeeper Jewel Andrew set to make way.
